Valve ha demostrado ser mejor que Cyberpunk 2077. Graficamente fue genial en su momento. La historia es maravillosa por mas que tenga 2 episodios a parte de esta. Es una obra maestra para el momento que lo sacaron. Podria haber sido el juego de la decada FACILMENTE. Ya que no necesitabas gran equipo para correr semejante motor. El juego es bastante simple. No tiene cinematicas, tiene minimos puntos de carga pero si el juego por ejemplo se hubiera tomado unos a√±os mas. NISIQUIERA hubiera necesitado de estos tiempos de carga.

RATE: 8/10

I have been working through my back log of single player games and decided to give HL and HL2 a shot. Needless to say HL2 is probably now one of my FAVORITE games. It is just so fun and really makes you think. Would reccomend to anybody.
Ahhh, this brings back memories; I used to play in college with my roommate and her boyfriend at the time. Then they broke up and I never really played since then. It's cool to re-discover it.
This game is a classic must play for everyone interested in fps and story driven games. Despite being made over 14 years ago, I believe it still is an amazing game which will give hours of fun.

Half Life 2 is a good game. Good story. Amazing characters. Good gameplay. Awesome music, I just imagine myself Papa Newell hitting the dance floor with some sick dance moves everytime those tunes start playing. Also, this game has the most horrific, desolated, scary motherfuckin level I've ever played in a First Person Shooter. Hands down to the people behind the whole idea of Ravenholm. That shit is nightmare fuel man. From the scarse bullets, the dark environments, the traps and the enemies... Oh my god the enemies... Those god damn awfull big headcrabs man, shit, just listening to the sounds they make I can feel one of those fuckers climbing up my back. I can't express in words how those black spider-like sonsofbitches make me feel but damn it's awesome. And that big zombie that they make? Running at you full speed... Throwing big headcrabs in your face... Damn. I got goosebumbs just by remembering that shit.

Amazing game.

Half-Life 2, uns dos meus jogos favoritos, mesmo n√£o superando o Half-Life 1, em minha opni√£o, ele √© incrivel, o carisma dos personagens a liberdade do jogador mesmo nos momentos de historia, ilumina√ß√£o, a jogabilidade e principalmente sua fisica, cada capitulo do jogo √© divertido e diferente, o jogo √© diverso, te ensinando a jogar sem se quer ter um tutorial antes, sem duvidas uns dos melhores FPS que j√° existiu.

Half-Life 2 is one of the most classic PC games of all times.  It‚Äôs a name that almost everyone in gaming recognizes.  You play as Gordon Freeman in a world that has been completely taken over by aliens called the Combine.  Using a variety of weapons and help from the rebel forces you‚Äôll fight through City 17 to defeat the combine and take back earth.  One of the more unique weapons in the game is the Gravity Gun which lets you pick up and throw objects at the enemies and is one of the more fun ways to defeat foes. 

While Half-Life 2 is a very iconic game it isn‚Äôt a perfect game.  There is one section where you‚Äôre driving an air boat through different canals that drags on for too long.  There are also several times where you must stop what you‚Äôre doing in order to solve a physics puzzle, most of which being some variation of a teeter totter.  Some of the unskippable cut scenes also take a long time.  However these are just minor complaints and none of them really affect anything overall.

Half-Life 2 is a really good game that was made when Valve made games and before they developed their phobia of the number 3.  If you‚Äôre looking for a solid first person shooter than this is a good game to try.
Combat is fun and graphics are amazing for its time

I like the game so far. It's challenging, and it makes me use my head a lot to figure out a puzzle. Fucking hate the Fast and Poison Headcrabs though.
